Subseries IV.A. Special Events and Publicity Director Keith Morris Files
Subseries IV.A. Special Events and Publicity Director Keith Morris Files

Keith Morris's files document his work organizing and publicizing events and promotional activities for Sports Illustrated (SI). His files also include extensive records regarding the SI tape service which mailed ending interviews of sports figures to radio and television stations.
Unreformatted audiovisual material in the collection is not accessible.

The staff newsletter FYI states in his 1987 death notice that Keith Morris was the Sports Illustrated (SI) director of publicity and special event for 32 years. The letter from the publisher confirms Morris was part of the founding staff of SI and states he was one of the best known staff members. From 1980 until his retirement in 1986, the Department Heads Lists have him only as the special events director. Prior to SI, he worked in the circulation promotion department for Time Inc. getting Time and Life placed on newsstands and in supermarkets.

Morris's early files contain some materials addressed to and from Terry Rice. In 1959 FYI describes Terry (Teressa) Rice as the "beautiful publicity woman," but her title isn't recorded until 1970 when she is the SI director of press information.
Barr, Donald J. "From the Publisher." Sports Illustrated Vault, 13 Apr. 1987, https://vault.si.com/vault/1987/04/13/from-the-publisher.
